entry.title: Digital Marketing
entry.content:
My daily business

I have been working in marketing agencies for more than four years. At first, I was working as a desktop publisher, often doing creative work, such as layouting, designing and photography, until I started working increasingly in the digital field. Currently I am working part-time as an online marketing specialist besides studying for my bachelors degree, which I will finish next summer. Tools like Google Ads, Facebook Business and Ads Manager or Google Analytics and the Tag Manager are all part of my daily work in the agency "Stutz Kommunikation". There we assist SMEs to promote their businesses, guide them through the digital jungle and help them to win new customers.

entry.title: Photo- & Videography
entry.content:
back | next

Photography on the job …

Photo- and videography: Topics that I was always interested about. I learnt the basics of photography in my apprenticeship and used the knowledge later in my career. I had the chance of taking photos of clients and for the newspaper "Zofinger Tagblatt". My photos got printed and published several times. During my time at the digital agency #ztplus, organising photo shoots was also part of my job. Besides taking photos behind the photo camera, I was regularly behind the video camera for live tv broadcasts in the studio of the local media outlet.

back | next

… and my personal projects

My camera is always with me, especially when travelling. I love exploring cities with my camera and taking unique photos. My Fuji X100s from 2013 is still considered my best buy ever. The little cam has been everywhere with me: in Australia, New York, Paris and of course in the Swiss mountains. I cannot wait to take it to Canada!

entry.content:

The rules of design

Pen and paper or even a brush have a decreasing importance in marketing. Nevertheless, the knowledge of design, composition or typography that I gained when I worked as a desktop publisher, often designing print and web projects, I still use regularly. Whether it is when creating mockups, in content creation or just in choosing a suitable font.

entry.title: Data Science & Programming
entry.content:
back | next

Learn from data

At university, I was able to gain experience in the field of Data Science. For a Data Science project I had to use several Python libraries and frameworks such as Numpy, Seaborn, Pandas or Scrapy and save the collected data in a SQLite database before analyzing everything in Jupyter notebook with Pandas and Numpy. The conclusion: Data science is very similar to marketing. You learn from data and draw your decisions from it.

Python and the web

Besides the data science projects, I used Python for other kinds of projects at university: small programs as well as larger ones. My favourite is still my Pyfeed project, in which Python is used on the web with the Flask framework.

entry.title: Web Development
entry.content:
back | next

My sandbox

In my work life I had the opportunity to use various content management systems such as Wordpress, Contao or Drupal as editor. However, in my spare time I often experiment with new web frameworks and tools (such as GatsbyJS, Wordpress or Jekyll) as a developer and designer for the sake of learning, and mostly because I enjoy coding. I also successfully completed the almost 30-hour LinkedIn Learning Path "Junior Wordpress Developer", where I learned the basics of Wordpress from a developer point of view. A particular interest of mine during development, is clean code and accessibility - a topic I have written a number of papers about, in my studies.
